title: Martine McCutcheon shows incredible figure after promising to be the  best version  of herself
body_text:
Martine McCutcheon shows incredible figure after promising to be the 'best version' of herself
Martine McCutcheon looked stunning as she showed off her figure in white denim shorts and an England football top and was met with a hundreds of compliments from fans
EastEnders star Martine McCutcheon looked incredible as she flaunted her figure in white denim shorts and an England football top.
The 48-year-old mum-of-one shared a selfie to her social media and was seen sporting a huge grin on herself as she geared up to watch Three Lions in the nail-biting Euros. Martine was met with compliments from fans after she 'embraced her 90s pin-up girl' in her latest snap to Instagram.
She wrote: "I embraced my 90’s pin up girl again last night!! It’s been a while… (I’m not breathing in, or holding my breath at all!) But I had fun and it felt good! Shes still there!!! The Mac’s felt England could have done better… But it ain’t over yet!! Rafferty was showing me all the shots that we 'Should have taken' And he was victorious in his match against Daddy. My footwear wasn’t suitable to play…'Sorry(not sorry) The shoes made my legs look good, so they weren’t coming off! I’d wake up with them on if I could! Here’s to the next Match! Have a fab Friday all!!"
Fans were quick to compliment the star on her incredible weight loss. One person wrote: "You look lovely." Another person penned: "This is giving 2006 World Cup and I am HERE for it!!!!!!" A third person added: "You look amazing."
The Love Actually actress star previously opened up about her health and fitness journey after welcoming her son Rafferty with partner Jack McManus. Back in 2022, Martine revealed that it had taken her "such a long time to find what works for (her)" and stated how important it is to just be the "best version' of herself."
In an interview with OK! Magazine, she said: "I think it takes a long time to work out what your own recipe is. It's taken me such a long time to look through all the stuff that's out there, and do just what works for me. So it's not as simple as just going on a crazy diet. I just feel it's really important to encourage women to just be the best version of themselves."
Martine also revealed she was able to stay in shape thanks to following the 80/20 rule diet. She said: "The 80/20 rule is what works for me. For 80% of my week, I will have mainly just healthy proteins, vegetables and fruit, organic and veggie juices, and Flora ProActiv spread. And then I'll have treats 20% of the time."
Back in 2011, Martine opened up about her struggles with chronic fatigue syndrome ME. She married Jack McManus in 2012, and they have a nine-year-old son, Rafferty Jack.
